clinical_study.brief_title: Non-invasive Negative Pressure Treatment for Pectus Excavatum
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy Evaluation of the Non-invasive Negative Pressure Treatment for Pectus Excavatum

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether the non-invasive negative pressure treatment with the use of the device Vacuum Bellfor is effective for the pectus excavatum treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Measurement of the reduction in the deepness of the pectus excavatum
primary_outcome.description: The patients will be submitted to clinical measurement of their anterior chest wall at three months interval until the closing of the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of quality of life related to self-esteem
secondary_outcome.description: The patients and their parents will be submitted to a quality of life questionnaire in the beginning and after one year using the device

other_outcome.measure: Evaluate the safety and adherence to the treatment
other_outcome.description: The patients will be followed to assure adherence and safety of the treatment

arm_group.description: Patients with pectus excavatum will be treated with the Vacuum Bell device

intervention.description: Patients with pectus excavatum will be submitted to a negative pressure treatment with the Vacuum Bell device

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- absence of co-morbidities that may interfere with proper placement or function of the apparatus
- test negative for pregnancy in women of childbearing age
Exclusion Criteria:
- skeletal diseases like osteogenesis imperfecta or osteoporosis
- clotting disorders such as hemophilia or thrombopathia
- skin diseases or infections of the anterior chest wall
- angiopathies or vascular fragility
- obesity important with BMI greater than 30
- precarious commitment to the prolonged use of the device protocol
